These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: responseType
attribute.description:
used to store the type of response in coded form. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "rt01" thru "rt99".

attribute.name: responseTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: responsiblePartnerCompanyCode
attribute.description:
the responsible partner company expressed as a project specific, one character code when referencing a non-chapterized parts data module.
Note
This code identifies an enterprise like a CAGE code. However, it must be a single character code, because it is used to generate the reference data module code.

attribute.name: rotate
attribute.description: can be zero or non-zero and is used to specify that the contents of the entry are to be rotated. If the value is "0", or the attribute is not used, then the text in the entry is presented in the orientation of the table (as set by the attribute orient. Refer to Para ). If the orientation is landscape, and the value of the rotate attribute is "1", the resulting text is displayed upside-down to the page’s headers and footers.

attribute.name: rowsep
attribute.description: defines the row separator setting. A non-zero value for this attribute will draw a rule below the table entries <entry>/ <captionEntry> to which it applies. If the attribute is zero, then no row ruling will appear below the entries to which it applies. The value of rowsep is ignored for the last row because the rulings for this row are given by the setting of the frame attribute. If the rowsep attribute is not used, this implies that a row rule will be drawn for the applicable rows. To set the row rulings for the complete row, set the attribute rowsep on element <row>/<captionRow> that represents the row. Any values that are given in the entries of the row will override the values given in the element <row>/<captionRow> or <captionGroup>/<tgroup>. This attribute must not be used for tables that only contain a graphic.

attribute.name: rulesContext
attribute.description: specifies the context (ie, the Schema) to which the contained rules apply. Context must be specified by the applicable URL of the Schema for XML encoded CSDB objects (eg, http://www.s1000d.org/S1000D_4-2/xml_schema_flat/descript.xsd).

attribute.name: runTimeDuration
attribute.description: defines the objects run time (this can be necessary for text to sound synchronization, common in e-learning).

attribute.name: safeFlight
attribute.description:
indicates if the equipment is safe for flight. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "0" - No, the equipment is not safe for flight
- "1" - Yes, the equipment is safe for flight

attribute.name: safetyCategoryValue
attribute.description:
specifies the supply requirement safety category. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "A" - for supply requirement alternatives mandatory for safety reasons
- "B" - for recommended supply requirement alternatives
- "C" - for common supply requirement alternatives

attribute.name: safetyLabel
attribute.description: contains a short description of the type of safety issue or a category selected from industry standard safety labels.

attribute.name: samplingRatio
attribute.description: the percentage of product instances to be sampled

attribute.name: samplingUnit
attribute.description: the product instance name

attribute.name: samplingValue
attribute.description: the number of product instances

attribute.name: sbAggregationLevelFlag
attribute.description:
indicates whether the duration and workload represent the sum up of duration and workload of all referenced procedure from the current Service bulletin. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "1" - Yes, the duration and workload represent the sum up of duration and workload of all referenced procedure from the current Service bulletin
- "0" - No, the duration and workload do not represent the sum up of duration and workload of all referenced procedure from the current Service bulletin

attribute.name: sbApprovalIdent
attribute.description: the approval identifier given by manufacturer approval authorities

attribute.name: sbComplianceCategory
attribute.description:
the compliance category of the Service bulletin. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "sbcc01" thru "sbcc99".

attribute.name: sbComplianceCategoryAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sbConcurrentStatus
attribute.description:
indicates when and if the list of referenced Service bulletin must be accomplished with current Service bulletin. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "previousOrParallel" - the referenced Service bulletin must be done before or simultaneously with the current one
- "previous" - the referenced Service bulletin must be done before the current one
- "notPrevious" - the referenced Service bulletin must not have been done before the current one

attribute.name: sbImpactType
attribute.description:
the type of the impact. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "sbit01" thru "sbit99".

attribute.name: sbImpactTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sbItem
attribute.description: identifies the item in the drawing

attribute.name: sbMaterialIdent
attribute.description: the identifier of a material set installed on the product , or removed from the product, or modified on the product during the embodiment of a Service Bulletin

attribute.name: sbMaterialIssue
attribute.description: the issue number being part of the identification of a material set installed on the product , or removed from the product, or modified on the product during the embodiment of a Service Bulletin

attribute.name: sbMaterialType
attribute.description:
the type of a material set installed on the product , or removed from the product, or modified on the product during the embodiment of a Service Bulletin. The attribute can have one of the following values:
• ""sbmt01"" thru ""sbmt99"".

attribute.name: sbMaterialTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sbModificationClassification
attribute.description:
the classification of the modification. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "minor" - a change classified as minor
- "major" - a change classified as major
Note
A "minor" change is one that has no appreciable effect on mass, balance, structural strength, reliability, operational characteristics, noise, fuel venting, exhaust emission or other characteristics affecting the operation of the product classified as minor. All changes other than "minor" are "major" changes.

attribute.name: sbModificationIdent
attribute.description: the design change or modification identifier

attribute.name: sbProcurableFlag
attribute.description:
whether the set of material is procurable. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "0" - No, the set of material or individual material is not procurable.
- "1" - Yes, the set of material or individual material is procurable.

attribute.name: sbReplacementType
attribute.description:
the specific condition applicable to the interchangeability condition. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "nominal" - no specific condition for its application
- "conditional" - a specific condition is applicable to the interchangeability condition which is expressed in the element <sbCondition>.

attribute.name: sbSupplierValue
attribute.description:
the supplier of set or individual set. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "manufacturer" - the set of material or individual material is provided by the responsible partner company of the Service bulletin
- "supplier" - the set of material or individual material is provided by a supplier different from the responsible partner company of the Service bulletin
- "any" - the set of material or individual material can be provided by any suppliers

attribute.name: sbTaskCategory
attribute.description:
the task type category of the Service bulletin. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "sbtc01" thru "sbtc99".

attribute.name: sbTaskCategoryAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sbTimeComplianceType
attribute.description:
the type of compliance time. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "sbtct01" thru "sbtct99".

attribute.name: sbTimeComplianceTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sbTopicType
attribute.description:
the topic type. Identifies the different topic types delivered within a Service bulletin. Attribute sbTopicType must be populated in accordance with the main topic where the element <sbTopic> is used. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "sbtt01" thru "sbtt99". and default BREX rules BREX-S1-00095, BREX-S1-00096, BREX-S1-00097 and BREX-S1-00098.

attribute.name: sbTopicTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:

These attributes can have one the following values:

- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

relation to, or choice of, SCO content data module.

- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

the categorization of the type of SCO. The type of SCO can be assigned by the needs of the project or the organization, or by the SCORM asset type definitions. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "scot01" thru "scot99".
The use of attribute scoEntryType indicates the need to transform the content of the element <scoEntry> to a corresponding data structure within an IMS/SCORM manifest.

attribute.name: scoMediaCode
attribute.description: n/a

attribute.name: scoMediaType
attribute.description: n/a

attribute.name: scormContentPackageIssuer
attribute.description:
The issuing authority is applicable in the SCORM module code to the characters identified as follows:
YY - YYYYY - YYYYY - NN (14 characters)
thru
YYYYYYYYYYYYYY - YYYYY - YYYYY - NN (26 characters)
To identify the issuing authority, it is recommended to use the CAGE code. The role, responsibility, and identification must be defined in the project business rules.
Markup attribute: scormContentPackageIssuer

attribute.name: scormContentPackageMediaCode
attribute.description: the media identification (label)

attribute.name: scormContentPackageMediaType
attribute.description: the media type (eg, paper, CD-ROM, DVD, online)

attribute.name: scormContentPackageNumber
attribute.description:
The number of the SCORM content packages is applicable in the SCORM module code to the characters identified as follows:
YY - YYYYY - YYYYY - NN (14 characters)
thru
YYYYYYYYYYYYYY - YYYYY - YYYYY - NN (26 characters)
The issuing authority assigns the number of the SCORM content package. The number is a unique alphanumeric identifier depending on the model identification code (attribute modelIdentCode) and the issuing authority (attributes scormContentPackageIssuer).
Markup attribute: scormContentPackageNumber

attribute.name: scormContentPackageVolume
attribute.description:
The volume is applicable in the SCORM module code to the characters identified as follows:
YY - YYYYY - YYYYY - NN (14 characters)
thru
YYYYYYYYYYYYYY - YYYYY - YYYYY - NN (26 characters)
This element is used in cases where a SCORM content package has to be separated into volumes without assigning a new number. Default value is "00" if only one volume exists.
Markup attribute: scormContentPackageVolume

attribute.name: scormcontentpackageXsd
attribute.description:
relation to, or choice of, SCORM content package Schema.
The attribute can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: screenLevel
attribute.description: the physical level of the screen in a shielding situation. Outer screens (over all screens) must have higher values than inner screens (screens of cables).

attribute.name: screenStyle
attribute.description: the style for the graphical presentation of the screen in a shielding situation

attribute.name: screenType
attribute.description:
the type of the wire in a shielding situation
Note
The attribute screenType describes the connection type of a wire (normally on both ends of the screen, a wire is connected to pin screens for example), connected to this screen or the shielded wire itself. Screen information for the complete screen is provided in the element <wireInfo>. Therefore it is recommended not to use the attribute screenType in this context.

attribute.name: sealedFlag
attribute.description:
a flag to specify whether the functional item is protected with sealing material or not. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "0" (D) - No, for non-sealing protected functional item
- "1" - Yes, for sealing protected functional item

attribute.name: securityClassification
attribute.description: the security and restrictive marking.

attribute.name: securityClassificationAttRelation
attribute.description:

These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: selectOrManufactureValue
attribute.description:
the type of selection to make. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "f" - select on fit
- "t" - select on test
- "m" - manufacture from
- "r" - reworked from - "p" - repaired from

attribute.name: senderIdent
attribute.description: the CAGE code of the sender of the comment, data management list or data dispatch note

attribute.name: separatorStyle
attribute.description:
the separator characters between a challenge and a response. The attribute separatorStyle can have one of the following values:
- "dot" (D) - a sequence of dots
- "line" - a line
- "none" - no separator

attribute.name: seqNumber
attribute.description: the sequence number of the CSDB object, related to senderIdent and yearOfDataIssue

attribute.name: serialNumberForm
attribute.description:
specifies if the serial number is a single value or a range of values. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "single" - specifies a single value
- "range" - specifies a range of values

attribute.name: serialNumberValue
attribute.description: the single value or the range of values. A tilde [~] is used to separate the two values. For example, LKJ123~LKJ777.

attribute.name: setAction
attribute.description: Functions on a single expression

attribute.name: setOperation
attribute.description: Operations between two expressions

attribute.name: show
attribute.description: xlink

attribute.name: showPluginControls
attribute.description:
used to hide or show the third party software plug-in controls. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "hide" - to hide the plug-in controls
- "show" - to show the plug-in controls

attribute.name: shuffle
attribute.description:
used to reorder the sequence of interactions within the assessment. The attribute can have one of the following values:
• "0" - No shuffle
• "1" - Shuffle
The attribute shuffle can be used to randomly redistribute the order of entire groups of assessment interactions or answer options as well individual assessment items within a group.

attribute.name: significantParaDataType
attribute.description:
the meaning of the data. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "psd01" thru "psd99".

attribute.name: significantParaDataTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: skillLevelCode
attribute.description:
the skill level required for the procedural step or the complete procedure. This attribute can have the following values:
- "sk01" thru "sk99".

attribute.name: skillLevelCodeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: skillType
attribute.description:
the required skill category of the person who will perform the task (eg, Airframe, Electrical, Avionic, Engine). The attribute skillType can have one of the following values:
- "st01" thru "st99".
The attribute skillType must have the same value as the attribute personCategoryCode of the element <preliminaryRqmts> in the <taskDefinition> branch of the maintenance planning ("schedule") Schema, if both attributes are used.
It is recommended to only populate the attribute personCategoryCode of the element <personCategory> when the child element <preliminaryRqmts> of the element <taskDefinition> is used.

attribute.name: skillTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sleeveMaterial
attribute.description: the material of which the sleeve is made

attribute.name: softwareClassificationValue
attribute.description:
the classification of the software. Projects or organizations are allowed to define their own software classifications. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "scv01" thru "scv99".

attribute.name: softwareClassificationValueAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: softwareCustomizationStatusValue
attribute.description:
the software customization status (eg, customization not allowed, customization allowed, customization mandatory). Projects or organizations are allowed to define their own software customization statuses. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "scs01" thru "scs99".

attribute.name: softwareCustomizationStatusValueAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sourceCriticality
attribute.description:
the impact of not complying with the requirement. The attribute sourceCriticality can have one of the following values:
- "sc01" thru "sc99".
Example of usage:
- "sc51" - no source criticality
- "sc52" - 1-star
- "sc55" - evident, safety

attribute.name: sourceCriticalityAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sourceOfRqmt
attribute.description: the code that indicates the origination of the requirement (eg, "MRB", "MPD" and "AD")

attribute.name: sourceTypeCode
attribute.description:
the type of source. The attribute sourceTypeCode can have one of the following values:
- "stc01" thru "stc99".
Example of usage:
- "stc51" - MSG-3 failure effect category
- "stc52" - enhanced zonal analysis program
- "stc53" - certification maintenance requirement

attribute.name: sourceTypeCodeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: sourcingTypeValue
attribute.description:
the type of sourcing (BFE, SFE, contract-dependent, etc). The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "stv01" thru "stv99".

attribute.name: sourcingTypeValueAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: spanname
attribute.description: a named, reusable span specification for merged occurrences of the element <entry>/<captionEntry>. The value must be the name of a span defined in the element <spanspec> in the current element <tgroup>/<captionGroup>.

attribute.name: sparePartClassCode
attribute.description: sparePartClassCode (M), specifies the class of the spare part. The attribute can have one of the following values: - "0" - non-procurable parts - "1" - expendable parts - "2" - rotable parts - "6" - repairable parts

attribute.name: specDocumentNumber
attribute.description: the identifier number of the specification

attribute.name: specDocumentType
attribute.description: the type of the document, always a specification for supplies

attribute.name: specialLabelFlag
attribute.description:
a flag to indicate that the supply product has a special labeling or not. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "1" - Yes, for supplies with special labeling
- "0" - No, for supplies without special labeling

attribute.name: specific
attribute.description:
the indicator if it is a standard or a special support equipment. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "1" (D) - a special support equipment including special tools. These support equipment must be presented in the table Support equipment in Preliminary requirements.
- "0" - a standard support equipment including standard tool

attribute.name: startupDuration
attribute.description: the duration for performing the actions specified in the Preliminary requirements

attribute.name: stepLabel
attribute.description: the label of the step

attribute.name: stringAction
attribute.description: Functions on a single expression

attribute.name: stringOperation
attribute.description: Operations between two expressions

attribute.name: subCategory
attribute.description: the subcategory of the fault part of the correlation
attribute.para_title: Computerized message from built-in test equipment

attribute.name: submitCaption
attribute.description: the caption used for the submit function push button.

attribute.name: submitCaptionAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: subSubSystemCode
attribute.description: the sub-subsystem code (part of the SNS).

attribute.name: subSystemCode
attribute.description: the subsystem code (part of the SNS).

attribute.name: supervisorLevelCode
attribute.description:
the level of the supervisor who must observe the task or inspect the results of the task. The attribute supervisorLevelCode can have one of the following values:
- "sl01" thru "sl99".

attribute.name: supervisorLevelCodeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: supplyNumber
attribute.description: the supply number. A unique label set by the project (eg, the supply trade name, a specification number).

attribute.name: supplyNumberType
attribute.description:
the type of supply identification. Projects or organizations are allowed to define their own supply number types. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "sp01" thru "sp99".

attribute.name: supplyNumberTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: supplyRqmtNumber
attribute.description: the supply requirement or supply requirement alternative number

attribute.name: supplyRqmtStatusValue
attribute.description: the status of the supply requirement (eg, not authorized, superseded, split)

attribute.name: supplyRqmtType
attribute.description: the type of the supply requirement alternative

attribute.name: systemCode
attribute.description: the system code (part of the SNS).

attribute.name: systemDiffCode
attribute.description: the system difference code.

attribute.name: systemIdentCode
attribute.description: the system identification code as defined by the project

attribute.name: tableOfContentType
attribute.description:
a classification of captions to be used in the publishing process to group captions in specific tables or indexes. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "none" (D) - do not include in any caption table
- "redtoc" - to be included in the red caption table
- "comdtoc" - to be included in a combined caption table
- "ambertoc" - to be included in the amber caption table
- "greentoc" - to be included in the green caption table
- "yelowtoc" - to be included in the yellow caption table

attribute.name: tabstyle
attribute.description: defines a style for the table. Although the CALS table model allows the value of this attribute to determine the presentation style of the table (in terms of the table rulings, the frame, the orientation etc), S1000D mandates that the presentation attributes are populated with the correct values to make the table display correctly in any application. This attribute must not be used for tables that only contain a graphic. The attribute tabstyle can be used by a project or organization to allow the definition and subsequent checking of business rules that apply standard project table.

attribute.name: targetPath
attribute.description: the identification of the portion of a destination data module addressed by the reference. The portion is identified by the use of an XPath expression.
attribute.para_title: References to portions of a data module from a SCO content data module

attribute.name: targetTitle
attribute.description: a human-readable tooltip to be displayed when for instance the cursor is hovering over the target identifier in a viewer application.

attribute.name: taskCategoryCode
attribute.description: the support equipment task category value

attribute.name: taskCode
attribute.description:
the task category code. For example, a general visual inspection is a common category. The attribute taskCode can have one of the following values:
- "taskcd01" thru "taskcdk99".

attribute.name: taskCodeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one of the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: taskIdent
attribute.description: the unique identifier for the list of tasks

attribute.name: taskName
attribute.description: the textual identifier of the task

attribute.name: taskSeqNumber
attribute.description: the sequential position of the task within the inspection tasks group

attribute.name: testCode
attribute.description: the identifier of the test

attribute.name: testType
attribute.description: the type of test

attribute.name: textDisplayPosition
attribute.description:
the text display placement in relationship to the data entry or selection. If the attribute is not used, the IETP implies that the text is positioned above for a user menu question, left for a user entry question, and right for menu choice text. The attribute textDisplayPosition can have one of the following values:
- "top" - the prompt is positioned above the data entry information
- "bottom" - the prompt is positioned below the data entry information
- "right" - the prompt is positioned right of the data entry information
- "left" - the prompt is positioned left of the data entry information

attribute.name: tgstyle
attribute.description: the table group style. This defines that a specified style (eg, column and row specifications) is to be applied to the table group. Although the CALS table model allows the value of this attribute to determine the presentation style of the table (in terms of the table rulings, the frame, the orientation etc), S1000D mandates that the presentation attributes are populated with the correct values to make the table display correctly in any application. The attribute tgstyle can be used by a project or organization to allow the definition and subsequent checking of business rules that apply standard project table.

attribute.name: thresholdType
attribute.description:
the starting point of the threshold. The starting point can be "from the beginning of the maintenance program" or "from the last time the inspection was performed". The attribute thresholdType can have one of the following values:
- "threshold" - the starting point is "from the beginning of the maintenance program"
- "interval" - the starting point is "from the last time the inspection was performed"

attribute.name: thresholdUnitOfMeasure
attribute.description:
the unit of measure for the threshold interval, the threshold or the tolerance value. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "th01" thru "th99".

attribute.name: thresholdUnitOfMeasureAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one of the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: timeLimitCategoryValue
attribute.description:
an enumeration representing the categories of time limits. The attribute timeLimitCategoryValue can have one of the following values:
- "1" - safety related
- "2" - non-safety related
The interpretation of these values can be defined by a project or organization business rule. However, the default interpretation of the values is as given above.

attribute.name: timeLimitIdent
attribute.description: the identifier of the element <timeLimit>.

attribute.name: title
attribute.description: xlink

attribute.name: to
attribute.description: the end value for a range of values

attribute.name: tocentry
attribute.description: determines whether the table will appear in the list of tables. If the value of this attribute is "0," the table’s title will not appear in the automatically generated list of tables at the front of the data module. If the value is not "0," or the attribute is not used, and the table has a title, it will appear in the list of tables. If the table has a title and you do not wish it to appear in the list of tables, you must specify a tocentry value of "0".

attribute.name: toleranceType
attribute.description:
the tolerance type that determines whether the value is related to the minimum value, the maximum value or both values. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "plus" - maximum value
- "minus" - minimum value
- "plusorminus" - plusminus value

attribute.name: toleranceValue
attribute.description: the value of the threshold

attribute.name: toolAltFlag
attribute.description:
the indicator if the tool is an alternative of the previously described tool. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "0" (D) - indicates that it is not an alternate support equipment
- "1" - indicates that it is an alternate support equipment

attribute.name: toolNumber
attribute.description: the tool part number or support equipment part number. Used together with the attribute manufacturerCodeValue, as the identifier of the tool or support equipment, in the tool repository or support equipment repository (implicit reference method).

attribute.name: toolRefType
attribute.description: the type of the relationship with the child support equipment and tools (eg, symmetry, replacement relationship)

attribute.name: twistingType
attribute.description: the type of twisting

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: xlink

attribute.name: unitOfMeasure
attribute.description: the unit of measure.

attribute.name: updateHighlight
attribute.description:
indicates whether the reason for update must appear in the highlights data module. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "1"- Yes, the reason for update must appear in the highlights data module
- "0" - No, the reason for update must not appear in the highlights data module
Refer to default BREX rule BREX-S1-00039.

attribute.name: updateReasonType
attribute.description:
indicates the type of the reason for update that it applies to, and is configurable. If this attribute is not used, a technical change is implied. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "urt01" - the changes are editorial (and therefore there must be no change markers in the data module that relate to this reason for update). There must be no technical changes in an element that relate to this reason for update.
- "urt02" - the changes are technical. Provided that the data module is not revised, there must be change markers that relate to this reason for update.
- "urt03" - the changes are related to markup only. If these changes affect the technical content of the data module, and the data module is of issue type changed, the changes that relate to this reason for update must be marked.
- "urt04" - the changes are to applicability markings only. If these changes do not affect the technical content (or the issue type is other than changed), there must be no change markings in the data module that relate to this reason for update.
- "urt05" - the changes are to referencing markings only. If these changes do not affect the technical content (or the issue type is other than changed), there must be no change markings in the data module that relate to this reason for update.

attribute.name: updateReasonTypeAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one of the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: updateXsd
attribute.description:
relation to, or choice of, update file Schema.
The attribute can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: valign
attribute.description:
when used in body element, sets the vertical alignment of the contents of each entry, unless overridden when used on element entry. The valign attribute's value defines the vertical position of a caption within its entry, it does not affect the alignment of the text within a caption. This attribute can have one of the following values:
- "top" (D)
- "bottom"
- "middle"

attribute.name: valueAllowed
attribute.description: contains the specification for the single value, range of values or pattern value applicable to the object. A range should be specified in the format defined in Chap 3.9.5.3. A pattern should be provided as a regular expression in accordance with "REC-xmlschema-2-20041028 "W3C Recommendation: XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition (2004 Second Edition)"

attribute.name: valueDataType
attribute.description:
the data type of the product attribute. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "string" (D) - for classical character chains
- "boolean" - for Boolean values ("true" or "false")
- "integer" - for integer values, which are numeric and contain no decimal point
- "real" - for real values, which are numeric and contain a decimal point

attribute.name: valueForm
attribute.description:
specifies the type of content contained in the attribute valueAllowed. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "single" - a single value applies to the object
- "range" - a range of values applies to the object
- "pattern" - a pattern value applies to the object

attribute.name: valuePattern
attribute.description: a pattern specifying the allowable structure for each value in the attribute applicPropertyValues in the element <enumeration>. The attribute valuePattern must only be used when the attribute valueDataType has the value "string" (refer to default BREX rule BREX-S1-00135). The pattern follows the XML Schema regular expression rules as described in the specification "REC-xmlschema-2-20041-28 W3C Recommendation: XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition (2004 Second Edition)".

attribute.name: valuePrecision
attribute.description: the precision of real type data

attribute.name: valueTailoring
attribute.description:
specifies if and how the given values can be tailored by a lower level BREX data module. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "restrictable" - a BREX at a lower level can impose further restrictions to the given value by changing the textual interpretation to reflect that restriction
- "lexical" - a BREX at a lower level can adjust the text string constituting the interpretation, however, only in respects that do not in any way change the conceptual and semantic meaning of the interpretation
- "closed" (D) - a BREX at a lower level must not in any way restrict or alter the interpretation of a value declared at this level

attribute.name: valueType
attribute.description:
the type of the variable value. The attribute valueType can have one of the following values:
- "boolean" - boolean type values are TRUE or FALSE
- "string" - string type values are alphanumeric
- "integer" (D) - integer type values are numeric and contain no decimal point
- "real" - real type values are numeric and contain a decimal point
- "set-string", "set-real", or "set-integer" - set type values represent an unordered list of like value types: string, real, or integer

attribute.name: variableDescr
attribute.description: a human-readable description of the variable. Often the variable name is not descriptive enough. The description is not normally seen by the end user.

attribute.name: variableName
attribute.description: a (short) name for the variable. The attribute variableName is not normally seen by the end user.

attribute.name: variableScope
attribute.description:
the scope of the variable. The attribute variableScope can have only one value:
- "local" (D) - the scope is for the entire user session. "local" is the only scope supported for variables declared within the process data module.

attribute.name: vendorFlag
attribute.description:
a flag to indicate if the specification list,supply requirement or supply requirement alternative is defined by the Product manufacturer or by a supplier. This attribute can have one of the following values:
- "0" - defined by the Product manufacturer
- "1" - defined by a supplier

attribute.name: verbatimStyle
attribute.description:
the style of verbatim text in cases where there are more than one type of verbatim information, and the types must be recognized and/or presented differently. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "vs01" rthru "vs99".

attribute.name: verbatimStyleAttRelation
attribute.description:
The configurable attributes indicating a BRDP has a relationship include the text "AttRelation" at the end of each attribute name.This is done to avoid redefinition of the types for configurable attributes defined in various S1000D Schemas.
These attributes can have one of the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: verificationType
attribute.description:
this attribute can have one of the following values for the first or second verification:
- "tabtop", used to indicate that the verification was carried out on a desktop
- "onobject", used to indicate that the verification was carried out at the Product
- "ttandoo", used to indicate that the verification was carried out at the Product and on a desktop

attribute.name: visibility
attribute.description:
controls how the graphical region is presented. It is set to the value "hidden" to turn off any graphical region that is not to be displayed for the current use of a graphic. Otherwise the value "visible" is assumed, which means that the graphical region will be displayed.
Note
The attribute visibility of the element <grobject> in the graphics companion file has three allowable values:
- "on" - the graphical region can be selected to be visible
- "off" - the graphical region cannot be selected to be visible
- "inherit" - the values "on" and "off" are inherited from the attribute pictureVisibility of the element <webcgm> in the graphics companion file, ie, "on" or "off"
The combination of the values for the attribute visibility of the element <hotspot> and the values for the attribute visibility of the element <grobject> provides the function of whether a graphical region can be selected for display or not. This combination has three allowable definitions:
- visible, not selectable, meaning one of the following:
- Do not define in a hotspot (do nothing).
- Define a hotspot without any internal references, data module references, or CSN references.
- Define a hotspot without any internal references, data module references, or CSN references and set the value of the attribute visibility to "visible".
- visible, selectable, meaning one of the following:
- Define a hotspot with at least one internal reference, data module reference, or CSN reference.
- Define a hotspot with at least one internal reference, data module reference, or CSN reference and set the value of the attribute visibility to "visible".
- not visible, not selectable, meaning:
- Define a hotspot with no internal reference, data module reference, or CSN reference and set the value of the attribute visibility to "hidden".
Note
The use of the definition, not visible, selectable, is disallowed.

attribute.name: vitalWarningFlag
attribute.description:
the indicator whether the warning is vital. The attribute vitalWarningFlag can have one of the following values:
- "0" - a non-vital warning
- "1" - a vital warning
Note
If the attribute vitalWarningFlag is used, the meaning of value "1" must be clearly stated. Compliance with country legislation and rules must be ensured.

attribute.name: volumeNumber
attribute.description:
the identifier of the volume of the media, defined by two numeric characters. It is used when the information needs to be separated into several volumes due to media restrictions.
Note
for publications: It is not related to the attribute pmVolume within the publication module code..
Note
for SCORM packages: It must correspond with the element <scormContentPackageVolume> within the SCORM module code.

attribute.name: warningIdentNumber
attribute.description: the unique identification of the externalized warning

attribute.name: warningRefs
attribute.description: the warning reference to the warnings and cautions collection.

attribute.name: warningType
attribute.description: the type of warning (eg, Electric shock, Chemical substance)

attribute.name: weightingFactor
attribute.description:
the factor customizing the score value of an interaction item. The attribute weightingFactor accepts numeric values to indicate the relative importance of an interaction item within an assessment scheme.
For example, when the importance of an assessment question is critical to the subject matter (such as a question concerning safety procedures), an interaction attribute weightingFactor can be assigned a numeric value calculated to trigger a fail threshold for a single incorrect response.

attribute.name: wireGaugeType
attribute.description:
the type of measure for the wire gauge. The attribute wireGaugeType can have one of the following values:
- "proj" - for wires which gauge type is measured in a project or an organization specific unit
- "awg" - for wires which gauge type is measured in accordance with the American Wire Gauge units
- "mt" - for wires which gauge type is measured in a metric unit

attribute.name: wireInstallationDirection
attribute.description: the direction information for non-symmetric wires

attribute.name: wireLengthType
attribute.description:
the type of wire length information. The attribute wireLengthType can have one of the following values:
- "critical" - the new wire must have exactly this defined length when a wire change is performed. Otherwise, the data delivered thru the wire will not be accurate.
- "estimated"- the wire length corresponds with the cut length without any constraints to the final length (after installation of the wire)
- "final"- the wire length corresponds with the length after installation of the wire
note: must not be used for solder sleeves

attribute.name: wireState
attribute.description:
the electrical state of a wire. Normally, wires are divided into physical electrical wires and logical connections (eg, the connection of a circuit breaker to the bus bar by a screw). The attribute wireState can have one of the following values:
- "active" - for wires which are active in one of the system circuits
- "stowed" - for wires which are stowed (not connected) at least on one end
- "pigtail" - for wires which are connected only at one end to an equipment of the system for measurement purposes
- "notactiv" - for wires which are not active in one of the system circuits
- "logconn" - for electrical connections in one of the system circuits which are not realized by a physical wire or do not have a wire identification (in some cases called flying leads)

attribute.name: worthinessLimit
attribute.description: the indicator whether the performance of the tasks is mandatory or recommended which signifies whether the task is subject to worthiness limitations

attribute.name: wrngdataXsd
attribute.description:
relation to, or choice of, wiring data module.
The attribute can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: wrngfldsXsd
attribute.description:
relation to, or choice of, wiring fields data module.
The attribute can have one the following values:
- "1", the BRDP relates to the Schema identified by this attribute
- "0" or omission of this attribute, "Not related"

attribute.name: year
attribute.description: the year of issue given as a four digit number

attribute.name: yearOfDataIssue
attribute.description: the year (YYYY) when the issue was raised

attribute.name: zoneNumber
attribute.description: the zone identifier

attribute.name: zoneRefType
attribute.description: the type of the relationship between the two child zones

attribute.name: zoneSideValue
attribute.description:
the side of the Product where the zone is located. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "lh" - for a zone located on the left side of the Product
- "lr" - when the zone is not located on any side of the Product
- "rh" - for a zone located on the right side of the Product

attribute.name: zoneType
attribute.description:
the type of the zone. The attribute can have one of the following values:
- "majorzone" - for a major structural area of the Product
- "subzone" - for a subdivision of a major structural area of the Product
- "specifzone" - for a specific zone of the Product
